name: andiron
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a shaped piece of metal, usually one of two, used to hold wood burning in a fireplace (= a space for lighting a fire inside a room): In the fireplace were well-polished andirons and old brass tongs.
carlosvelayos/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesEverything, from the andirons in the fireplace to the books on the table, was exactly as it would have been 50 years ago.I admired a great heron in wrought iron that stood opposite its mate as andirons in the large stone fireplace.She is shown kneeling to polish an andiron in the mansion of a wealthy employer.Colourful paintings cover the walls, accentuated unexpectedly by an andiron or an American Indian rug. The logs were propped up by large stones that served the purpose of andirons.
